metadata.dc:title: Vogt-Koyanagi-Harada disease: rare cause of uveitis
metadata.dc:description: The Vogt-Koyanagi-Harada syndrome (VKH) is a bilateral, diffuse granulomatous uveitis associated with poliosis, vitiligo, alopecia, and central nervous system and auditory signs. This inflammatory syndrome is probably the result of an autoimmune mechanism, influenced by genetic factors, and appears to be directed against melanocytes. In the paper is presented a rare case of probably VHK disease in 12-year old caucasian race boy (AU)

metadata.dc:description: La enfermedad de Vogt-Koyanagi-Harada es una uveítis granulomatosa difusa bilateral, asociada a poliosis, vitíligo, alopecia y síntomas neurológicos y auditivos. La etiología es probablemente autoinmune contra los melanocitos, determinada por factores genéticos. Es una entidad muy rara en la edad pediátrica. Presentamos un nuevo caso en un paciente de 12 años de edad (AU)
